Class BoardRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.view.BoardRenderer
public class BoardRenderer extends Object
Renders the Tetris game board and brick displays using JavaFX. This class handles all visual aspects of the game including: the main board, active falling brick, ghost brick preview, and next brick queue.

The renderer uses GridPane layouts and Rectangle shapes to display the game state with color-coded cells for different brick types.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardRenderer

      public BoardRenderer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane ghostBrickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanel, int brickSize)
      Constructs a BoardRenderer with the specified UI components.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - the GridPane for displaying the main board
      brickPanel - the GridPane for the active falling brick
      ghostBrickPanel - the GridPane for the ghost brick preview
      nextBrickPanel - the GridPane for next brick previews
      brickSize - the pixel size of each brick cell

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the board display with the given matrix and brick data.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the initial board state
      brick - the view data containing brick information

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick, boolean isPaused)
      Refreshes the brick display with updated position and shape.
      Parameters:
      brick - the current view data
      isPaused - whether the game is paused (skips refresh if true)

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Updates the game board background display.
      Parameters:
      board - the current board matrix state
